With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Yudkow, Emperors of California. After the Event, California, the greatest and most populous of the former American states, fell into a period of constant war. Kings and warlords shed rivers of blood to impose their will upon the land, and great houses rose and fell with the tide. Elton the Lawgiver was once a philosopher in the service of one of these great houses, and when his lord was betrayed and murdered by his own retainers, Elton took it upon himself to fulfill the dream of a united California. His diplomacy and teachings on the Cetic faith swayed kings and armies to his cause, and those he could not persuade he defeated in battle. Loved by commoners and respected by nobility, Elton was not the first unifier of California, but he and his house were the ones to make it stick, finally ending the centuries-long era of warring states and making California a beacon of peace, prosperity and rebuilding in the post-Event world.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Royall, Emperors of the Holy Columbian Confederacy. In the 24th century, what used to be known as the American Deep South was in chaos. Backwoods tribes and scattered kingdoms warred endlessly with each other, and the Evangelical Church found itself under siege from a powerful heresy known as Posthumism. A vicious war between Posthumite and Evangelical kingdoms lasted for decades, until Leonidas Royall led the Evangelicals to victory. Claiming inspiration from his studies of Old America, Leonidas consolidated these conquests under his rule, and then united all the southern realms under his banner one by one, be it by diplomacy or war. This was the start of the Holy Columbian Confederacy, an empire Leonidas claimed was the true successor to Old America. After a Confederate campaign to take Washington DC was stopped by a rare alliance of Americanists, Anabaptists and Occultists, Leonidas stopped expanding the empire, but under his dynasty it would become one of the most powerful and stable realms of the post-Event world, politically and culturally an equal to mighty California.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Rodham, Kings of Hudsonia. Claiming direct descent from one of New York State's pre-Event ruling families, the Rodhams marched north from Manhattan in the late 24th century to reclaim their birthright from the Occultist kingdom of New England. Taking advantage of local revolts against the Mahonic kings, financial support from House Wayne, and his own political savvy, the ambitious Ellis I Rodham formed a mighty army, which took the Hudson Valley and Albany itself within the first two months of his campaign. By 2381, he had united all the state under his banner save the Republic of New York, whose independence he respected out of gratitude for the Waynes' help years before. Under his family's rule, Hudsonia's fortunes would wax and wane over the centuries, facing periods of prosperity alongside the challenges of war, rebellion, internal religious strife, disease, and loss of territory to Anabaptists and Rust Cultists. In the end, the Rodhams' main line faded from power not through violence, but love.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Yoder, who united much of Pennsylvania under the rule of the Deitsch. Though Deitscherei would continue under other dynasties for several centuries, House Yoder was wiped out when the childless Kaynich Abram II was murdered by Americanists. His successor, Samuel Stolzfus, avenged him by invading Washington and killing President Smithson, setting off a cycle of violence and retribution between Americanists and Anabaptists that ended with a a brutal sack of Washington, D.C. Since then, the traditional Anabaptist doctrines of pacifism and religious freedom have largely been set aside.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Creaux, who conquered most of the Mississippi River Delta to form the Kingdom of Louisiana. House Creux went on to conquer parts of western Texas while staying true to their Voodoo faith, defying both the Catholics of the Midwest and the Evangelicals of the South in the process. Although it is diplomatically isolated and does not own the city of New Orleans, Louisiana's position as the preeminent kingdom in the Gulf Coast region remains uncontested.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Nokono, Kings of Comancheria. After the cataclysm, the Comanche, led by House Nokono, broke free from the reservation system and reconquered their ancestral homeland in northwestern Texas, forming the Kingdom of Comancheria. Although the founder of House Nokona, Pahayoko I, followed the traditional faith of his ancestors, his son Moseh converted to the Christian faith of his Texan subjects. This decision proved to be a wise one, as it reduced tensions between the Texan majority and the native ruling class while also protecting Comancheria from the threat of external conquest. Moseh and his descendants were thus able to consolidate their earlier conquests and make Comancheria into a stable feudal kingdom. In 2666, Comancheria has reclaimed almost all of the ancestral Comanche homeland and is by far the most powerful realm in all of Texas.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Sulley, Kings of Moskitia. House Sulley has ruled the Kingdom of Moskitia for over 300 years. Their founder, King Newman, is reputed to have himself lived for over 300 years, an unparalleled feat in the post-Event world. Under the guidance of House Sulley, the Kingdom of Moskitia became one of the oldest and most stable kingdoms in all of Central America, serving as the core of both the Miskito people and the cult of the Falling Star.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Avondale, a wealthy and influential Americanist dynasty that produced three different Presidents over the course of 200 years. The dynasty was brought to a violent end by the Viking Albert Soady, who sacked Chicago and sacrificed President Anatol Avondale and his family to Odin.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Pitchstone, the Americanist kings of Dakota. Ned Pitchstone is widely regarded as one of the greatest post-Event Presidents, taking over after President Bannister Smithson was slain by the Deitsch, avenging him, and consolidating Americanist rule in the Midwest. His daughter Margaret was the first woman elected to the Presidency, but she faced a Sioux resurgence and Catholic holy wars, and after her death the kingdom was reconquered by the Sioux and House Pitchstone faded into obscurity.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Iturbide, Kings of Mexico. The Iturbides accomplished something few ever have, restoring a pre-Event nation and its culture and having their kingdom recognized as a continuation of that ancient land. For a time, they even ruled the entirety of Old Mexican territory. Nearly all of this was lost over the centuries, but they maintained control of the ancient capital, and stubbornly keep the memory of Mexico alive.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Mahonic, Kings of New England. Vincent Mahonic was a mighty warrior who united the Occultist tribes of New England into one kingdom, then forged a realm that stretched from Buffalo to New Brunswick, earning a reputation even in old age as one of the most feared men in the Northeast. Vincent's kingdom would last nearly 200 years, but it was never the same after his assassination - his son Keziah lost all of New York to the Rodhams by 2381, and in 2459, New Brunswick and Miramichi broke away. Enraged, Zadok Mahonic called together one of the largest Occultist hordes ever seen and vowed to restore Vincent's empire, starting with Hudsonia. Instead, his army was smashed at the Battle of Saratoga Springs, where Zadok was slain in a mad charge against Norton Rodham. Zadok's death sparked a massive power struggle among the Occultists, who had lost faith in House Mahonic, and by 2500, New England had collapsed back into warring tribes.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Castel of Quebec. Queen Véronique united Quebec in the mid-2500s, finally achieving the dream of a united and independent Quebec. Although her kingdom would not survive her death, Véronique's descendants held and continue to hold various petty titles in the Northeast. Two of her daughters married into Houses Groot and Lengacher, and her son Jacques was the Duke of Detroit prior to his murder at the hands of Overseer Coleman the Liberator.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Soady. One of the greatest Viking raiders of America, Albert Soady embarked from Marquette with hundreds of longships for a great circular voyage down the Mississippi and up the East Coast, exacting tribute from or pillaging every city along the way and sacrificing hundreds, including President Anatol Avondale, to Odin. He returned home with mountains of gold and united all the Jarls of Superior under his reign, but the kingdom did not last long after his death. His lands were divided between his children, and with none of them powerful enough to hold on to the crown, the Kingdom of Superior became a historical footnote.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Tagötöka, High Chieftains of Northern Basin. Tavibo, known to his adherents as "The Holy" and to nearly everyone else as "The Mad", was a mystic who attempted to recreate the deeds of Emperor Elton I of California by preaching his own new philosophy drawing on Cetic, Gaian, and Mormon teachings and conquering a significant part of eastern Oregon. However, his empire never stabilized and, after his death, was divided amongst his children, who each took something different from his teachings.

With a score of $SCORE$ you$FAILED$ beat House Sylvain. House Sylvain's founder, Jean-Baptiste, was turned into a zombi by a wicked bokor, condemning him to a life of slavery. However, Jean-Baptiste managed to break free from this supernaturally-induced state of servitude and sired four bastard children after being zombified, a feat which baffles priests to this day. After siring his fourth child, Jean-Baptiste traveled to South America seeking power and glory. He was in the middle of carving out a kingdom in the Andes before dying unexpectedly of "brain rot". However, his three sons - Jean-Claude, Jean-René, and Jean-Louis - continued in their father's stead, winning small realms for themselves in the mountains of Colombia. One of these realms happens to contain the ancient Colombian capital of Bogotá.

The American South has managed to reconstruct itself modestly enough. Core portions of what was once known as the 'Deep South' were reunited centuries ago, and this empire, being one of the strongest realms east of the Mississippi, has taken to styling itself as the legitimate successor to Old America. Can its wildest ambitions ever match up with reality? What of the Southern dukes and counts who refuse to bend the knee?

column1: ant Saint-Empire romain tandis que les rois chrétiens gagnent du terrain sur une Espagne musulmane divisée et affaiblie. La Scandinavie se convertit rapidement au christianisme, tandis que les colons nordiques installés en Russie et en Bretagne s'assimilent aux populations locales. Cependant, les descendants des Vikings implantés en Normandie et en Italie se préparent à de nouvelles conquêtes, et le temps de la première croisade approche...
column2: Im späten 10. und frühen 11. Jh. änderten sich die Machtverhältnisse der muslimischen Welt, als türkische Dynastien wie die Seldschuken und Ghaznaviden die Vorherrschaft in Persien übernahmen. Das Byzantinische Reich bestand fort, doch ihm sollten schlimme Zeiten bevorstehen. Frankreich und das Heilige Römische Reich teilten sich die Herrschaft über den Westen und die Mitte des europäischen Festlandes, während christliche Könige gegen ein ungeeintes und geschwächtes muslimisches Spanien vorrückten. In Skandinavien breitete sich das Christentum schnell aus und die Wikinger, die sich in Russland und auf der Britischen Insel niedergelassen hatten, wurden von der dortigen Bevölkerung assimiliert. Ihre Nachkommen jedoch, in der Normandie und in Italien, rüsteten sich für neue Eroberungszüge und das Zeitalter der Kreuzzüge nahte...
column4: A finales del siglo X y comienzos del XI, el mundo musulmán cambió, con dinastías turcas como los selijúcidas y los gaznávidas ahora dominando Persia. El Imperio bizantino aún se mantenía pero se le acercaban tiempos difíciles. La Europa continental central y occidental estaba escindida entre Francia y un fuerte Sacro Imperio Romano, mientras que los reyes cristianos avanzaban ante una debilitada y fracturada España musulmana. Escandinavia pronto se convirtió a la cristiandad y los colonos nórdicos en Rusia y Bretaña fueron integrados a las poblaciones locales. Además, los descendientes de los vikingos en Normandía e Italia se preparaban para nuevas conquistas, y se acercaba el momento de la Primera Cruzada...

column2: The mass destruction of the Old World was, in many ways, a godsend for the Indians of Old America. With the governments that once oppressed them destroyed, the Native Americans were free of the reservation system, and began expanding outwards once more. Unlike the days before the Indian Wars however, these revitalized nations are now a minority in their own lands, and have had to compromise their rule with Anglo-American vassals and acknowledgement of the Papacy in New Rome. In such a state, can the Indians survive in this new world?

Pagan/tribal rulers are allowed to subjugate other pagan/tribal rulers once in their lifetime. (With the 'Become $KING$' ambition, there is no such time limit against targets within the kingdom.) Free men are always willing to follow the mightiest ruler...

column4: Heiden dürfen einmal im Leben andere heidnische Anführer unterwerfen. (Mit der '$KING$ werden'-Ambition gibt es kein solches Zeitlimit gegen Gegner innerhalb des Königreiches.) Freie Männer sind immer willens, dem stärksten Herrscher zu folgen...

column2: The pillaging and looting undertaken in your name has earned you a reputation as a fearsome Viking raider. All along the coasts of America, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible [Root.GetFirstName], scourge of the seas, will come ashore with his undead warriors and eat them.
column3: Les pillages commis en votre nom vous ont valu une réputation de redoutable pillard viking. Tout le long des côtes européennes, les mères bordent leurs enfants le soir en leur disant que s'ils ne sont pas sages, le terrible [Root.GetFirstName], le fléau des mers, débarquera avec ses guerriers morts-vivants pour les manger.
column4: Das Brandschatzen und Plündern in Eurem Namen hat Euch den Ruf eines furchtlosen Wikinger-Räubers eingebracht. An allen Küsten Europas bringen Mütter ihre Kinder abends zu Bett und flüstern Warnungen, dass der Schrecken [Root.GetFirstName], die Geißel der Meere, mit seinen untoten Kriegern kommen und sie fressen wird, wenn sie sich nicht benehmen.
column6: El pillaje y el saqueo llevado a cabo en tu nombre te ha dado una reputación de temible asaltante Vikingo. A lo largo de las costas de Europa, las madres advierten a sus hijos cuando llega la noche que si no se comportan, el terrible [Root.GetFirstName], castigo de los mares, llegará a tierra con sus guerreros muertos vivientes y se los comerán.

Après avoir séjourné de nombreux mois dans votre cour, ils ont réussi et vous êtes devenu(e) célèbre à travers le monde en tant que puissant(e) [Root.GetTitle] à l'ours blanc dansant.

Después de pasar varios meses en tu corte, han tenido éxito y te has hecho famoso en todo el mundo como el poderoso [Root.GetTitle] con el oso blanco que baila.

column4: Geschichtliches hat Euch schon immer interessiert, und die letzten Wochen habt Ihr Euch ganz dem Studium der Feldzüge Alexanders des Großen gewidmet. Aus der Beschreibung seiner Feldzüge im Osten konntet Ihr wertvolle Erkenntnisse gewinnen.
column6: La Historia es una materia que siempre te ha llamado la atención, y has pasado las últimas semanas estudiando las campañas de Alejandro Magno. Se pueden aprender mucho de sus conquistas en oriente.

column2: History is a subject that has always fascinated you, and you have spent the last few weeks studying the campaigns of El Libertador. There are many lessons to be learned from his conquests.
column3: L'histoire est un domaine qui vous a toujours fasciné, et vous avez passé les dernières semaines à étudier les campagnes d'Ashoka le Grand. Ses conquêtes sont riches de nombreux enseignements.
column4: Schon immer war die Geschichte ein Fach, dem Euer besonderes Interesse galt, und so habt Ihr Euch in den letzten Wochen eingehend mit den Feldzügen Ashokas des Großen befasst. Das Studium seiner Eroberungen war höchst aufschlussreich.
column6: Siempre te ha fascinado la historia, y en las últimas semanas has pasado muchos ratos estudiando las campañas de Ashoka el Grande. Se puede aprender mucho de sus conquistas.

column2: After many months studying the campaigns of the ancient generals of antiquity you have acquired many fascinating insights and gained new wisdom in military matters. You realize that the Art of War might be well worth studying.
column3: Après des mois passés à étudier les campagnes d'Alexandre le Grand, vous avez acquis de nombreuses et fascinantes connaissances, ainsi qu'une nouvelle vision de la chose militaire. Vous pensez qu'il pourrait être bon de vous plonger dans l'étude de l'art de la Guerre.
column4: Nach mehreren Monaten des Studiums der Feldzüge Alexanders des Großen, durch das Ihr viele neue Erkenntnisse gewannt, hat sich Euer Verständnis für militärische Belange deutlich verbessert. Ihr erkennt, dass das Studium der Kriegskunst sich durchaus lohnen könnte.
column6: Después de muchos meses estudiando las campañas de Alejandro Magno, has aprendido muchas cosas sobre asuntos militares. Te parece que el Arte de la Guerra merece la pena estudiarla bien.

column4: Endlich habt Ihr Euer Studium der Bekenntnisse des heiligen Augustinus beendet. Es waren viele Nächte von Nöten, um das Werk zu lesen, in denen eine Kerze Eure einzige Gesellschaft war, aber Ihr bereut es keine Sekunde. Euer Wissen hat sich erhöht.
column6: Por fin has conseguido terminar de estudiar las Confesiones de San Agustín. Hicieron falta muchas noches de lectura con la luz de una vela como compañía, pero no te arrepientes en absoluto. Tu aprendizaje ha mejorado.

column2: The studies you have conducted in your observatory have convinced you that there are many strange things beyond the known cosmos. There are few sources and no one to share knowledge with you, however. But you have heard of a strange old scholar in the Great Basin who is rumored to possess vast knowledge of the weird.
column3: Les études que vous avez menées dans votre observatoire vous ont convaincu du grand nombre de choses étranges et inconnues dans le ciel. Cependant, les sources sont minces et vous ne trouvez personne pour échanger à ce sujet. Mais vous avez entendu parler d'un vieil érudit dans le désert d'Arabie, dont on dit qu'il posséderait de vastes connaissances sur les phénomènes étranges.
column4: Die Studien in Eurem Observatorium haben Euch überzeugt, dass es jenseits des bekannten Kosmos viel Merkwürdiges gibt. Es gibt jedoch kaum Quellenmaterial und niemanden, mit dem Ihr Euer Wissen teilen könnt. Wie es heißt, soll es jedoch in der arabischen Wüste einen kauzigen alten Gelehrten geben, der großes Wissen über merkwürdige Phänomene besitzt.
column6: Los estudios que has llevado a cabo hasta ahora en el observatorio te han convencido que hay muchas cosas extrañas más allá del cosmos conocido. Existen pocas fuentes y pero no hay nadie que comparta  conocimientos contigo. Pero has oído que existe un extraño erudito en el Desierto de Arabia de quien se rumorea que posee vastos conocimientos de lo raro.

column2: You arrive at the abode of the strange old scholar Isappu. After some persuasion, he invites you in. You speak at length, and he tells of you of the scholar Howard the Mad, who knew many things of the strange spheres beyond and of talking beings that are not human. You find out that Howard the Mad wrote a book called the Necronomicon, in which he recorded many strange and unholy truths. Isappu says that as he is impressed by your sincerity and desire for knowledge, he can sell you a copy of the book. He tells you to beware, however, as too much intense study of the Necronomicon is said to drive the reader insane...
column3: Vous parvenez à la demeure de l'étrange érudit que l'on appelle Isappu. Vous le persuadez à vous faire entrer. Vous discutez longuement. Il vous parle d'un érudit du nom d'Howard le Fou, qui connaissait bien des choses sur les étranges sphères de l'au-delà, et qui parlait d'êtres qui n'étaient pas hmains. Vous apprenez qu'Howard le Fou a écrit un livre du nom de Necronomicon, dans lequel il a consigné un grand nombre de vérités étranges et impies. Isappu se déclare impressionné par votre sincérité et par votre soif de connaissance, et se dit prêt à vous vendre un exemplaire du livre en question. Il vous met cependant en garde : une étude trop poussée du Necronomicon peut rendre fou...
column4: Ihr seid bei der Behausung des kauzigen alten Gelehrten Isappu angekommen. Dank Eurer Überredungskünste lädt er Euch in seine Wohnung ein. Ihr führt ein langes Gespräch, und er erzählt Euch von dem Gelehrten Howard dem Irren, der viele Dinge über die seltsamen jenseitigen Sphären wusste und die sprechenden Wesen kannte, die nicht menschlichen Ursprungs sind. Ihr erfahrt, dass Howard der Irre ein Buch namens Necronomicon verfasste, in dem er viele seltsame und gottlose Wahrheiten zu Papier brachte. Isappu sagt, dass Eure Aufrichtigkeit und Euer Streben nach Wissen ihn beeindrucken würden und er Euch ein Exemplar des Buches verkaufen könnte. Er warnt Euch jedoch, da es heißt, dass ein allzu intensives Studium des Necronomicons den Leser in den Wahnsinn treiben würde...
column6: Llegas a la morada del viejo erudito extraño Isappu. Tras cierta persuasión, te invita a pasar. Hablas con mucho detalle, y él te cuenta del erudito Howard el Loco, quién sabía muchas cosas sobre las extrañas esferas de más allá y hablar con seres que no son humanos. Descubres que Howard el Loco escribió un libro llamado el Necronomicón, en el cual registró muchas verdades extrañas y profanas. Isappu, diciendo estar impresionado por tu sinceridad y deseo de conocimiento, puede venderte una copia del libro. Pero te aconseja tener cuidado, pues el estudio intenso del Necronomicón puede volver loco a su lector.

column2: Shortly after the death of your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], you are brought a strange piece of news. It seems that [From.GetHerHis] library was raided, the only item stolen being a strange old book of Paiute origin. Two servants who were in the library at the time were found dead, though witnesses refused to describe the state of the bodies.
column3: Peu de temps après la mort de votre [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], on vous fait part d'une étrange nouvelle. Il semble que sa bibliothèque a été pillée. Le seul livre dérobé est un vieux livre étrange d'origine arabe. Deux domestiques qui se trouvaient dans la bibliothèque au moment du vol ont été retrouvés morts. Cependant, les témoins ont refusé de décrire l'état dans lequel se trouvaient les corps.
column4: Bald nach dem Tod von [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] erhaltet Ihr merkwürdige Nachrichten. Es scheint, dass in [From.GetHerHis] Bibliothek eingebrochen wurde und nur ein einziger Gegenstand gestohlen wurde, nämlich ein seltsames altes Buch arabischer Herkunft. Die zwei Bediensteten, die sich zu jener Zeit in der Bibliothek aufhielten, wurden tot aufgefunden, obwohl Augenzeugen sich weigerten, den Zustand der Leichen zu beschreiben.
column6: Poco después de la muerte de tu [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], te llega una extraña noticia. Parece que [From.GetHerHis] biblioteca fue allanada. Al parecer el único artículo robado siendo un extraño libro antiguo de origen árabe. Dos sirvientes que estaban entonces la biblioteca fueron encontrados muertos, aunque los testigos se negaron describir el estado de los cuerpos.

column2: Purity is respected by the clergy and monastics of your religion. Like Prestige, it is added to your score on the death of a ruler.
column3: La pureté est respectée par le clergé et les moines de la religion jaïnite. La pureté affecte également la loyauté de vos vassaux jaïns. Comme le prestige, il s'ajoute à votre score lorsqu'un souverain meurt.
column4: Reinheit wird vom Klerus und Mönchen der jainistischen Religion respektiert und beeinflusst die Loyalität Eurer jainistischen Vasallen. Ähnlich Prestige wird Reinheit beim Tod Eures Herrschers zur Punktzahl gerechnet.
column6: La pureza es respetada por el clero y los monjes Jaina, y también afecta a la lealtad de tus vasallos Jaina. Como el prestigio, se añade a tu puntuación al morir el gobernante.

column2: Word has reached you that your mortal enemies, the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] family, are planning the construction of a great galley the likes of which has never before been seen. It is to surpass even the iron flagships of old in size and splendor. The hubris of [From.GetTitledFirstName] is without equal!\n\n[Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName], your [Root.GetSpymasterName], has put together a plan to make sure this atrocity never sails the seas. Men loyal to [Root.job_spymaster.GetHerHim] will infiltrate the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] shipyard in [Root.MercRepCapital.GetName] posing as shipwrights. Once inside, they will add several subtle structural flaws to the galley that will hopefully escape detection until it sets out on its maiden voyage...
column3: Vous entendez dire que vos ennemis jurés, les [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], projettent la construction du plus grand navire que le monde n'ait jamais vu. Il devrait même surpasser en taille et en splendeur le Bucentaure, ce somptueux navire-amiral du Doge de Venise. La démesure de [From.GetTitledFirstName] est sans égale ! \n\n[Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName], votre [Root.GetSpymasterName], a ourdi un plan pour assurer que cette atrocité ne puisse jamais voguer sur les mers. Des hommes qui lui sont loyaux vont se faire passer pour des charpentiers et infiltrer le chantier naval de [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] à [Root.MercRepCapital.GetName]. Lorsqu'ils seront sur place, ils intégreront quelques subtils défauts à la structure de le navire. Ceux-ci ne seront sans doute pas détectés avant que le navire entreprenne son long voyage...
column4: Euch ist zu Ohren gekommen, dass Euer Todfeind, die [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] Familie, den Bau einer großen Galeere plant, von einem Ausmaß, das es nie zuvor gegeben hat. Es soll in Größe und Herrlichkeit sogar die Bucentaur überflügeln, das Flaggschiff des venezianischen Dogen. Die Selbstüberschätzung von [From.GetTitledFirstName] kennt keine Grenzen!\n\n[Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName], Euer [Root.GetSpymasterName], hat sich einen Plan ausgedacht, der dafür sorgen wird, dass diese Grässlichkeit niemals auf den Meeren segeln wird. Männer, die [Root.job_spymaster.GetHerHim] gegenüber loyal sind, werden die [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] Werft in [Root.MercRepCapital.GetName] infilitrieren, indem sie sich als Schiffsbauer ausgeben. Sobald sie im Innern sind, werden sie viele bauliche Mängel an der Galeere vornehmen, die hoffentlich nicht entdeckt werden, bis sie zu ihrer Jungfernfahrt ausläuft
column6: Te han llegado rumores de que tus mortales enemigos, la familia [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], planea construir una gran galera de dimensiones nunca vistas. Sobrepasará en tamaño y esplendor incluso al bucintoro, el buque insignia del dux de Venecia. ¡La arrogancia de [From.GetTitledFirstName] no tiene parangón!\n\n[Root.job_spymaster.GetTitledFirstName], tu [Root.GetSpymasterName], ha elaborado un plan para asegurarse de que esta atrocidad no surque jamás los mares. Sus leales hombres se infiltrarán en el astillero de [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] en [Root.MercRepCapital.GetName] haciéndose pasar por carpinteros de ribera. Una vez en su interior, provocarán sutiles defectos estructurales en la galera que con suerte pasarán desapercibidos hasta que el buque realice su viaje inaugural...

column2: Liege is Anabaptist
All Jews will be expelled from the realm. You will be able to add their considerable personal wealth to your treasury, but Jews will not return for many years.

More than 3,000 years ago, God aided the Children of Israel in their escape from slavery by inflicting ten plagues upon ancient Egypt. The last of these saw a spirit of the Lord slay every first-born in Egypt, but 'pass over' Jewish homes marked with the blood of a slaughtered lamb. This festival celebrates the return of freedom to the enslaved Jewish people.
column3: Il y a plus de 3 000 ans, Dieu aida les Enfants d'Israël à fuir l'esclavage en infligeant les Dix Plaies d'Égypte. Pour la dernière de ces plaies, Dieu envoya un esprit qui causa la mort de tous les premiers-nés d'Égypte, mais qui ignora les maisons des juifs car ils en avaient marqué les portes du sang d'un agneau.\nLa fête célèbre le retour à la liberté pour le peuple juif réduit à l'esclavage.
column4: Vor über 3000 Jahren half Gott den Kindern Israels bei ihrer Flucht aus der ägyptischen Gefangenschaft, indem er Ägypten mit 10 Plagen heimsuchte. Bei der letzten Plage schickte Gott einen Geist, der jeden Erstgeborenen in Ägypten erschlug. Nur die Häuser der Israeliten, die mit dem Blut eines geopferten Lamms gekennzeichnet waren, wurden verschont. Das Pessach-Fest wird zum Gedenken an die Rückkehr der Juden in die Freiheit gefeiert.
column6: Hace más de 3.000 años, Dios ayudó a los Hijos de Israel a huir de la esclavitud enviando diez plagas sobre el Antiguo Egipto. En la última de ellas un espíritu del Señor hizo matar a todos los primogénitos de Egipto, excepto los de aquellos hogares judíos cuya puerta estuviera marcada con la sangre de un cordero sacrificado. Esta festividad celebra el retorno del esclavizado pueblo judío a la libertad.

column2: Build a New Yeshiva
The religious buildings of Brookyln have fallen into disrepair. Now that New York is ruled by a Jewish Melech, the time has come to begin construction of a new yeshiva and synagogue.
New Yeshiva Under Construction
New Yeshiva Built

Construction of a new yeshiva and a new synagogue will begin immediately in the Crown Heights region of Brooklyn. Although they are no replacement for the Temple, they will nevertheless be the grandest religious buildings this side of the Mississippi. Your architects estimate that their construction will take roughly four years. When they are finished, they will surely be a sight to behold!
The rabbis of old would surely approve!
Construction on the New Yeshiva has begun.
The New Yeshiva

Construction has finally finished on the new yeshiva and synagogue in Crown Heights, and both buildings, closely associated as they are, are referred to as "the New Yeshiva" by the locals.\n\nTheir design is grander in scope and stature than those of any other religious buildings constructed since the time of Old America. The complex has become a dominant feature of New York, instantly recognizable by travelers from afar. The rabbis of old would have surely been moved to tears by the sight.
It is magnificent.
Install a Grand Rebbe

Brooklyn has established itself as the spiritual capital of Judaism in America thanks to the New Yeshiva. Perhaps a new rabbi - one with authority over all Jews in America - could be instated as well?.
The Grand Rebbe

Judaism has not had an official religious head since the Romans destroyed the Second Temple roughly two and a half thousand years ago. However, with the construction of the New Yeshiva, this has changed.\n\nAlthough the title of High Priest remains defunct, the rabbi in charge of the New Yeshiva, informally known as the Grand Rebbe, has nevertheless been recognized the ultimate Orthodox religious authority in America. Rabbis from all across the continent have agreed that his decisions shall take precedence over those made by other rabbis.
Long live the Grand Rebbe!

A Jewish exile, fleeing persecution elsewhere in America, has showed up at your court. His time spent abroad has gifted him with many connections, and by all accounts he is an able diplomat. He would make a fine chancellor.
The Cadaver Synod

You have received strange news from St. Louis. The former Pope, [From.GetTitledFirstName], did by his actions and lifestyle so defile the Holy See that the current authorities have decided to put his corpse on trial!\nThe corpse of [From.GetTitledFirstName] was removed from its tomb and brought to the papal court for judgement. It was propped up on a throne, and a deacon was chosen to speak for it as its legal representative.\nThe accused was found guilty on all accounts and subjected to a punishment most dire. The corpse was stripped of its papal vestments, three fingers on the right hand (those used to give blessings) were cut off, and then it was interred in a graveyard normally reserved for foreigners of low status. The punishment still not being deemed severe enough, the corpse was then exhumed again, tied to weights and cast into the Mississippi.
The Iterumnalia sweeps across the Americas as the second Feudal era draws to a close.

A Horrible Affliction

Our people in [plague_outbreak_location.GetName] are suffering from a frightening epidemic. Those afflicted by the disease experience piercing pain and violent madness, and bleed profusely from all of their orifices as well as from gaping skin lesions. Death comes quickly thereafter, even to victims healthy only a few days earlier. Dread is spreading, seeping into the heart of the realm while our healers are at a loss - there is no cure to the horror wreaking havoc among the populace. The cause of the disease is unknown and those trying to protect themselves are left to their own devices. Bodies are piling up, riddled with bloody lesions... The Red Death is at our doorstep.
Word of an Epidemic

We have received news of an epidemic in [plague_outbreak_location.Realm.GetName]. The information is vague, but word is people are dying like flies and the fear of the disease is spreading as fast as the affliction itself. Furthermore, the condition is reported irreversible as well as incurable, and the scattered records of the events are worrisome. With no source of evil revealed people are turning to their gods and on each other, to protect themselves from contagion. Many call it a new plague.

We have received news of a horrible epidemic in [plague_outbreak_location.GetName], part of [plague_outbreak_location.Realm.GetName]. At first the rumors were thought to be exaggerated, but ever since the disorderly arrival of inconsolable refugees at our gates, it has been difficult to ignore what is happening. They tell of various symptoms, and our couriers from the area report seeing bloody lesions, people vomiting blood before dying, while others are driven into a mad frenzy... biting their caretakers as they froth at the mouth. Terror is spreading as rapidly as the disease and so far there has been no mention of a cure... Only mass graves. Is this the will of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]?
The Plague Approaches

Mobs of new people are arriving in [bordering_province.GetName]. Most of the newly arrived are commoners fleeing the plague that has reached [infected_province.GetName] just beyond the borders of our realm. Some have lost their whole families, some are trying to protect theirs and a few are travelers or merchants that had an easier time moving. All of them seem to have witnessed indescribable horrors, hardly any will talk about it at all. The ones that do talk, warn others of the coming plague and urge them stay inside or pack their things and flee.

Thrax has spread across South America, from high in the Andes to the steamy jungles in the southeast. While the people sought refuge in the temples at first, now they too lay deserted, only corpses bowing before the gods. Bodies bloated beyond recognition float down the Orinoco.

The roads throughout Mexico and Central america are dotted with shrines to Santa Muerte and many other minor saints of protection and death, seemingly to no avail against the Red Death. Entire villages are gone from the world of the living, disregarding the wealth and good harvests the area was enjoying. The reality is stark, as death continues to spread and despair paves its road.

Across the Caribbean, the Red Death arrives by ship and is spread further by pirate raiders taking advantage of the chaos. There are rumors of islands isolated enough to be untouched by the outbreak, but they are few and far between. To further disturb the people a story is circulating - survivors speak of a cursed ship, carrying living corpses come to recruit for their captain of death...

Death is stalking the Great Plains as Thrax spreads among the nomads and prairie kingdoms. Lesion-riddled bodies lay rotting in the sun and the stench is unbearable. Many have fled the larger settlements but the epidemic follows with the bodies floating down the Mississippi and the Missouri.

The Red Death has spread high into the Rockies, and across the searing deserts of the American Southwest. The few surviving stragglers from these secluded mountain sanctuaries speak of only one thing: death.

Death comes to all, and across the American South the terror is becoming mundane. From the Everglades to the Appalachian Mountains, nobles and peasants alike crowd the churches praying for forgiveness and mercy. The road from Atlanta to Savannah is reportedly littered with miles of bloody corpses. Travels to the area are currently discouraged.

When Thrax first spread up the great central valley of California, many sought refuge in the temples. Now temple steps across the region are stained red with the blood of the dead, and monks are tasked with burning their bodies even if it means they too succumb.

The icy northern realms of Canada were thought to be safe from the Red Death... but death comes to all men, no matter their rank or where they live. The countryside of the afflicted areas have been left haunting and desolate.

An ominous shadow surrounds the Great Lakes as Thrax has left little but tragedy in its wake. Along the coasts, pyres from the burning of the diseased can be seen from miles away. Despite the heavy quarantine in the harbors, numerous ghost ships have been spotted eerily drifting across the lakes and down the St. Lawrence.

No one is safe as the Red Death tears through the lands of the American Northeast. The streets of many cities lay deserted as their inhabitants have fled in fear. The tribes are riding into the wilderness, desperately trying to escape the epidemic. Trails of bloody bodies mark their passing.
Nomadic warriors use eagles to aid them while hunting. Being responsible for the training of these companions is a great honor.
While pillaging through the ruins of a temple in Washington, I stumbled across an odd-looking crown...
It must be the Papal Tiara!
Prying open a tomb in Manhatan that had been sealed for centuries, I found a very old wooden chalice...

column6: Tras un horrible asedio, Jerusalén ha caído por fin. Al entrar en la ciudad la sangre de los infieles llegaba hasta las rodillas de los caballos.

This signals a new era of large scale Christian holy wars - the Crusades.

column4: Christliche Pilger im Heilige Land werden vielfach misshandelt und die Wege dorthin sind nicht sicher. Este hecho marca el inicio de una nueva era de guerras santas cristianas de gran alcance: las Cruzadas.

Dies ist der Beginn eines neuen Zeitalters großer christlicher Heiliger Kriege - der Kreuzzüge.
column6: Roma, ciudad de San Pedro y sede del mismísimo Papado, ha caído en manos de los infieles. column2: Although post-Event Merchant Republics are not true democracies, they still give their citizens certain rights and privileges that feudal realms do not offer, such as religious freedom. Because of this, the heads of merchant republics are barred from demanding religious conversion and interfaith relations tend to be warmer. However, as a Patrician, you are still after more Holdings, and you need an heir of your family. Leadership of the Republic changes between the five major Patrician families through special elections. Patricians can also build a network of Trade Posts, even in the counties of other powers...
column3: Jouer un patricien au sein d'une république marchande est semblable à l'expérience qu'offre un seigneur féodal : vous cherchez toujours à posséder davantage de propriétés et vous devez avoir un héritier pour votre famille. Cependant, la gouvernance de votre république tourne entre les cinq familles patriciennes majeures par le biais d'élections spéciales. Les patriciens peuvent ainsi construire un réseau de comptoirs, même dans les comtés qui dépendent d'autres régimes...
column4: Als Patrizier einer Handelsrepublik zu spielen, ähnelt dem Spiel als Feudalherrscher. Nach wie vor ist der Erwerb neuer Liegenschaften Euer Ziel und auch für einen Erben müsst Ihr sorgen. Allerdings gibt es innerhalb einer Republik spezielle Wahlen, durch die festgelegt wird, welche der fünf großen Patrizierfamilien die politische Führung der Republik übernimmt. Daneben können Patrizier ein Netzwerk von Handelsposten aufbauen, sogar auf dem Gebiet anderer Mächte ...
column6: Encarnar a un patricio de una república mercante no es completamente diferente a encarnar a un señor feudal: sigues tratando de hacerte con más propiedades y necesitas un heredero en tu familia. No obstante, el liderazgo de la República cambia entre las cinco familias de patricios principales a través de unas elecciones especiales. Los patricios también pueden establecer una red de puestos comerciales, incluso en países de otras potencias...

column2: The White Panther

Lately, you have heard persistent rumors from peasants and travellers in the wilds that a strange, mythical beast has been sighted in your realm. It's a white panther, powerful and elusive. The common folk claim it comes from another world and that the hunter who claims it will be imbued with divine power.
column3: Ces derniers temps, les paysans et les voyageurs font courir le bruit qu'une bête mythique a été aperçue dans vos terres. C'est un panthère blanc, puissant et insaisissable. Le peuple dit que cette créature vient d'un autre monde et que le chasseur qui abattra l'animal recevra un pouvoir divin.
column4: Seit Kurzem verbreitet sich unter Bauern und Reisenden das Gerücht, dass ein seltsames, mythisches Tier in Eurem Reich gesichtet wurde. Es handelt sich um einen weißen Panther, mächtig und scheu. Das gemeine Volk behauptet, er stamme aus einer anderen Welt und wer ihn erlegte, der werde von göttlicher Macht erfüllt.
column6: Últimamente, has escuchado rumores persistentes de campesinos y viajeros de las regiones desoladas que se ha visto una bestia extraña, mítica en tu reino. Se trata de un Ppantera blanco, poderoso y evasivo. El pueblo llano afirmar que proviene de otro mundo y que el cazador que lo reclame se imbuirá de poder divino.

column2: Good news, my [Root.GetLordLady]! We have received credible reports of a recent sighting of the great white panther in the county of [From.GetName].
column3: Bonne nouvelle, M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady] ! Des personnes dignes de confiance disent avoir récemment croisé le grand panthère blanc dans le comté de [From.GetName].
column4: Gute Nachrichten, oh [Root.GetLordLady]! Wir haben glaubwürdige Berichte erhalten, dass ein großer weißer Panther vor kurzem in der Provinz [From.GetName] gesichtet wurde.
column6: Buenas noticias, mi [Root.GetLordLady]! Hemos recibido informes creíbles de un avistamiento reciente del gran pantera blanco en la provincia de [From.GetName].

column2: On the hunt, you get separated from your party in the wilderness. As you are roaming around and trying to find your bearings, you glimpse something strange in the distance... you ride closer and see a fearsome great white panther! As you cautiously approach, it sees you and runs away. You try to follow but are unable to catch up in the difficult terrain.\n\nAs you get back to your party, you find you can't stop thinking about this strange animal.
column3: Pendant la chasse, vous perdez votre groupe de vue et vous vous retrouvez seul dans la nature. Alors que vous essayez de vous repérer, vous entrevoyez quelque chose d'étrange au loin... Vous chevauchez dans sa direction et découvrez un terrifiant panthère blanc ! Vous vous approchez doucement, mais la bête vous aperçoit et s'enfuit. Vous tentez de la suivre mais le terrain accidenté vous empêche de la rattraper.\n\nVous rejoignez votre groupe de chasse sans parvenir à chasser l'étrange animal de votre mémoire.
column4: Auf der Jagd werdet Ihr in der Wildnis von Eurer Jagdgesellschaft getrennt. Beim Versuch, die Gruppe wiederzufinden, erblickt Ihr in der Ferne etwas Seltsames... Es scheint sich um einen majestätischen weißen Panther zu handeln! Doch dann, beim Versuch sich ihm zu nähern, wird er auf Euch aufmerksam und ergreift die Flucht. Ihr versucht, ihn zu verfolgen, könnt ihn aber aufgrund des schwierigen Geländes nicht einholen.\n\nWährend Ihr zur Jagdgesellschaft zurückkehrt, müsst Ihr ständig an dieses seltsame Tier denken.
column6: Durante la caza, te separas de tus compañeros en el páramo. Mientras das vueltas y tratas de encontrar tu rumbo, vislumbras a algo extraño en la distancia ¡Cabalgas cerca y ves un tremendo pantera blanco! Como te lo acercas cautelosamente, te ve y se escapa. Tratas de seguirlo pero eres incapaz de alcanzarlo en este terreno difícil.\n\nCuando vuelvas con los tuyos, descubres que no puedes dejar de pensar en este extraño animal.

column2: You have gathered your followers and your hunting dogs, you have saddled your horse and prepared your weapons. You are ready to set out to hunt the great white panther.
column3: Vous avez rassemblé votre suite et vos chiens de chasse, fait seller vos chevaux et préparer vos armes. Vous êtes maintenant prêt à chasser le grand panthère blanc.
column4: Ihr habt Eure Getreuen und Eure Jagdhunde versammelt, das Pferd gesattelt und die Waffen vorbereitet. Nun seid Ihr bereit, die Jagd auf den weißen Panther zu beginnen.
column6: Has reunido a los tuyos, tus perros de caza, ensillado tu caballo y preparado tus armas. Estás listo/a para cazar al gran pantera blanco.

column2: After many days of hard hunting and tracking, you have finally managed to trap the white panther in a cul-de-sac between two rocks. The great animal is at your mercy - it looks at you with intelligent eyes, and you are suddenly struck by its great beauty...
column3: Après plusieurs jours de rude traque, vous parvenez à acculer le panthère blanc entre deux rochers. Le bel animal est à votre merci. Il vous regarde de ses yeux intelligents et, soudain, sa grande beauté vous frappe.
column4: Jagd und Aufspüren des Tieres erweisen sich als schwierig und langwierig. Doch nach zwei Tagen schafft Ihr es schließlich, den weißen Panther in einer Sackgasse zwischen zwei Felsen in die Enge zu treiben. Das große Tier ist Euch ausgeliefert und es sieht Euch mit klugen Augen an. Plötzlich werdet Ihr seiner enormen Schönheit gewahr...
column6: Después de muchos días de difícil caza y rastreo, por fin, has logrado atrapar al pantera blanco en un callejón sin salida entre dos rocas. El gran animal está a tu merced... Te mira con ojos inteligentes y de repente te sientes impresionado por su gran belleza...

column2: During your hunt, you come to a deep gorge. Right on the other side is the white panther, staring at you! You are so close, yet cannot reach it. As it runs away, you realize that you must return home without a victory this time.
column3: Au cours de la chasse, vous atteignez une profonde gorge. De l'autre côté de la faille, c'est le panthère blanc qui vous regarde ! Vous en êtes si proche et si loin à la fois... Il s'enfuit soudain et vous comprenez qu'une fois de plus, vous rentrerez bredouille.
column4: Während der Jagd gelangt Ihr an eine tiefe Schlucht. Genau auf der anderen Seite befindet sich der weiße Panther und starrt Euch an! Ihr seid ihm so nah und doch könnt Ihr ihn nicht erreichen. Als er wegläuft, wird Euch klar, dass Ihr dieses Mal keinen Sieg davontragen werdet.

Auyán-tepui

You have arrived in the jungles of Canaima, where Auyán-tepui is located. A long and perilous trail through the jungle will take to the sacred mountain and the legendary Angel Falls. For centuries, Hindus have been making pilgrimages to the rugged Guyana Highlands in pursuit of spiritual knowledge.\n\nAs you reach Auyán-tepui, you are struck by the majesty and beauty of the Angel Falls. A steady stream of water descends from the peak of the mountain, thousands upon thousands of feet in the air, before falling to the ground and forming a small river. This river will eventually travel to the ocean, the source of all water, and then return to this same peak. It is all part of an endless cycle...
I, too, am part of this cycle.
Arrival in Radha Madhav Dham.

You have finally made it to the heart of Texas, in Austin, the site of the Radha Madhav Dham. This temple was built as a representation of the ancient land of Braj, birthplace of Radha and Krishna. It is said that this ancient temple was built by a man named Prakashanand Saraswati, although his ultimate fate has been lost to history. Since then, the devoted have traveled to this place to give their offerings and see this most holy of Hindu places. Today thousands of pilgrims come here, and to the Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Houston, every year to celebrate the festival of Janmashtami.
It is beautiful!
The Temple in the Sea

On the coast of the island of Trinidad lies one of the most famous Hindu temples in the Americas. Known simply as the Temple in the Sea, it is one of the holiest places in the entire world. For over a thousand years, pilgrims have visited this holy temple, built by a humble migrant long before the Event. They have sought enlightenment and purification or, in some cases, to die in this place where salvation is guaranteed.\n\nEager to perform your own cleansing, you approach the entrance of the temple and walk up a set of stairs into the main antechamber. As you pray, you reflect on Ganges, Krishna and the cycle of rebirth.
I believe it is time for a bath!
